descriptionSet.description: An image with the title "Evolution of Gandhiji" has Gandhi standing on the part of the globe that depicts India as he bleeds, with a gun lying by his feet and his hands folded, in a poster published by Kanhyalal Lachoomal, Delhi. The poster shows the stages in Gandhi's life from his birth to his death. As a baby he is depicted on a lotus flower, and then as student. The stages that follow are that of him as a barrister, as the first revolutionary in South Africa, as the leader of the non-cooperation movement and then the Dandi march. Next comes his imprisonment, the Quit India movement, and the declaration of independence. The last image is that of Gandhi laid to rest. The image on the right hand corner is that of two Indian flags crossed, with a lit lamp in front and a banner that says 'amar jyoti' or eternal flame.

inscription.text: Birth 2-10-1869 Student 1887 Barrister 1907 South Africa's first revolutionary 1914 Non-cooperation activist 1920 Dandi March 1930 Activities while in jail- 183? (missing numeral) Go away 1942 Complete independence 15 August 1947 Death 30-1-1948 eternal flame
Stockists: KANAHYALAL LACHOOMAL 741, Chandni Chowk Delhi
Copyright Reserved, Published By: C. C. Co.
BOLTON FINE ART OFFSET LITHO WORKS. BOMBAY. 7

description-en: An image with the title "Evolution of Gandhiji" has Gandhi standing on the part of the globe that depicts India as he bleeds, with a gun lying by his feet and his hands folded, in a poster published by Kanhyalal Lachoomal, Delhi. The poster shows the stages in Gandhi's life from his birth to his death. As a baby he is depicted on a lotus flower, and then as student. The stages that follow are that of him as a barrister, as the first revolutionary in South Africa, as the leader of the non-cooperation movement and then the Dandi march. Next comes his imprisonment, the Quit India movement, and the declaration of independence. The last image is that of Gandhi laid to rest. The image on the right hand corner is that of two Indian flags crossed, with a lit lamp in front and a banner that says 'amar jyoti' or eternal flame. (sp)
